intro: Corydalis wyomingensis, commonly known as the Wyoming Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Wyoming. It is a member of the Fumariaceae family, characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers and slender stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations, often in alpine or subalpine habitats. Its flowers, which are usually pink or purple, bloom in late spring to early summer. Corydalis wyomingensis is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its unique appearance.
